info.title: Attachments
info.description:
This service allows you to manage attachments and attachment URLs for business objects. You can perform operations such as create, read, rename, and deletion of attachments. You can also read an existing document info record (DIR), and add attachments to it. The service returns an appropriate success or error response while performing the attachment operations.

Consumers of this service can configure the Harmonized Document Management (HDM) functionality to support attachments from various document frameworks such as Generic Object Services (GOS), Document Management System (DMS), and ArchiveLink. If this configuration has been maintained, this service also supports uploading and downloading of attachments that are larger than 100MB.

If the HDM configuration has not been maintained for a business object, then this service supports attachments only from the GOS and DMS document frameworks. For more information on HDM, refer to the Business Documentation linked below.

x-sap-shortText: Manage attachments using this synchronous inbound service

tags.name: Harmonized Document Management for Line Items

post.summary: Returns a URL and token to upload an attachment to a given SAP Object Type or SAP Object Node Type.
post.description: Returns a URL and token to upload an attachment to an SAP Object Type or SAP Object Node Type. To upload an attachment to an SAP Object Type, you must pass the SAP object type, file name, object key, and document type.To upload an attachment to an SAP Object Node Type, you must pass the SAP object type, SAP object node type, file name, object key, and document type. The URL and one time valid token is returned in the response to enable the upload of files that are larger than 100 MB. You can upload the attachment to your business object using this URL and token.

get.description: Retrieves the details of all the document info records such as document number, type, part, version, description, is document marked for deletion, and so on.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Filter items by property values, see [Filtering](https://help.sap.com/doc/5890d27be418427993fafa6722cdc03b/Cloud/en-US/OdataV2.pdf#page=64)

post.description:

*Please note that "Try it out" is not supported for this request.*
